result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie A Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $350 + costs = $1024.75 plus $200 DNA Surcharge plus the $75 drug testing fees= $1299.75,to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on June 15,2015 and on the 15th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 25 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

Reminder Notice--Final Notice
TTP slip
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 1:45pm [mo]
Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Stephanie A Martinez in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. De La Rosa indicates that even though the State offered Probation in the Criminal Case Settlement, Ms. Martinez does not wish to be placed on Probation

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. De La Rosa 

The Court questions Ms. Martinez of the success of previous Probation term

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $350 + costs = $1024.75 plus $200 DNA Surcharge plus the $75 drug testing fees= $1299.75,to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on June 15,2015 and on the 15th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 25 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
recess: 2:08pm
Status conference on May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 22, 2015 at 10:40 am.

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
Conflict review worksheet

case called at 3:22pm. [MK]
Defendant Stephanie A Martinez in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth isted on the Criminal Complaint is correct. Ms. Martinez provides a new address of: 410 1/2 N. Fifth Street, Watertown WI 53094.
Service of Complaint admitted,  the charges and maximum penalties are recited; Ms. Martinez waives the reading of the factual portion of the Criminal Complaint.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
--to go to the Jefferson Public Defender Office today to arrange for an eligibility determination

The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that then-DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Ms. Martinez. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
recess 3:30pm. 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 3/17/15 at 2:00pm.
